p: The barks (246.80 g) and leaves (237.28 g) were sterilized and dried in a laminar flow cabinet at 40°C for 10 and 6 days, respectively. Subsequently, the samples were pulverized using a cutting mill. The sample was extracted with 800 mL of 80% ethyl alcohol at ambient temperature with regular shaking at every 24 h. After 72 h, the mixture was filtered using a filter paper (0.45 μm), rotoevaporated at 35°C and lyophilized to obtain the ethanolic extract of barks (EEB) and leaves (EEL) of O. minarum.
